sub_title: Software Developer / Integration Engineer at Ericsson Telecommunicatie B.V.
summary:
With a career in both software developer and integration engineer roles, as well as a broad technical background, I can be deployed in a multitude of activities in the solution lifecycle.
As a software developer I am responsible for the technical solution. Activities include input to feasibility phase, detailed design, development of software components, and testing. As well as coordination tasks and support to design teams.
As an integration engineer I am responsible for the deployment of a technical solution in the customer environment. This involves low level design, deployment and configuration of infrastructure and software components, integration towards customer endpoints, customizations (such as scripting), verification and acceptance test. My work is internationally oriented and required worldwide travel to engage in complex projects. As an on-site integrator I am the main point of contact for the local organization or customer, the home organization, and the design and support organizations.
The diversity of projects enables me to study new technologies, and then apply this into documented procedures and knowledge transfer to my colleagues. The last years I have been active as frontrunner for a technology shift towards public cloud and containerized solutions. My main strengths are my analytical and troubleshooting skills, and a strong technical background enabling me to be deployed in a wide range of demanding situations. My drive is to maintain a high standard of quality and be result oriented.

projects.title: Azure infrastructure for containerized telecom service.
projects.description:
Lead integrator in a productization project of a containerized telecom service. Responsible for the design and development of the Azure cloud infrastructure. Notable technologies used are Azure ARM templates, Docker Images, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure MySQL database, Azure SQL database, Azure Cache for Redis, networking, auditing, and automation.
Activities included: Analysis, dimensioning and design of the Azure infrastructure. Development of Azure ARM templates and scripting for deployment. System testing, analysis of software faults and providing feedback to design teams. Creation and execution of test tools for performance and stability testing. Documentation and training of support organization. Creation of CI/CD pipelines in GitLab for automation and testing.

projects.title: Virtualized (VM) and Containerized (Kubernetes) deployments in the Microsoft Azure Cloud
projects.description: Contributed to an integration project to lift and shift a telecom platform from virtualized hosts to the Azure cloud. This included feasibility study, prototyping, design and development of a cloud infrastructure, including scripting for installation and monitoring, and documentation. And at a later stage included integration design, deployment, maintenance and support of multiple large production environments. Notable activities were network design and security, dimensioning, analysis and setup of Red Hat Enterprise Linux "BYOS" images for deployment in Azure cloud, Bash, AZ CLI and (Azure) PowerShell scripting, prototyping of Azure MySQL database, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure SQL database, and monitoring through Azure Dashboard and Grafana. Performed complex monitoring and troubleshooting of loss of heartbeat of database, clustered filesystem and other components due to performance of the Azure network. Provided support and training on Azure cloud infrastructure to various teams and stakeholders.

projects.title: Deployment, integration, and verification of telecommunication service
projects.description:
Onsite integration activity in Latin America. Responsible as sole/lead integrator for deployment, integration, and verification of a telecommunication solution at a customer in Latin America. Of interest were trade compliance and embargo considerations. As well as continuous changes to scope, environment, and planning.
Responsible for data gathering, Low Level Design, and technical alignment with design organization, local organization, and customer. Activities included post-assembly HPE server and switching hardware setup and configuration. Deployment of VMWare VShpere/ESXi environment. Deployment of Red Hat KVM environment. Deployment of a load balancer pair (HA Proxy/VRRP/Keepalived based) with special consideration for SIP protocol flows over UDP, and L3 integration with customer network. Deployment of a Red Hat and JBoss based clustered (Glusterfs, Consul) application server with database (MySQL) and caching (Redis) functionality. Performed integration to customer environment, verification, acceptance test and training to customer.

projects.title: Development of a Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) service in the telecom domain.
projects.description: Design of a Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) service which provides proxy service between circuit switched networks (traditional telecom protocols such as SS7/MAP) and packet switched networks (IMS/SIP). As single/lead designer my responsibilities included reporting to management and stakeholders, technical analysis, support on requirement setting, creation of technical design, setup of design environment and tooling, actual development of the Java code, setup of and performing function testing, writing of documentation, delivery and support towards customer, and handover to low-cost design center for software maintenance. The project was difficult to staff until I took the challenge with the commitment to take responsibility for the full technical implementation, which was executed on-time, in-budget, and with no major faults. The service has since been delivered to multiple operators where I provided further technical input, integration and coordination activities.

projects.title: Java EE development and design of a telecommunication service.
projects.description: Responsible as lead designer for uplift to a newer baseline and implement functional changes of a telecommunication service for an operator in the Caribbean. Performed technical analysis and design, as well as coordination, task assignment and support of offshore design team. My tasks include support during the requirement settings phase, providing input and estimation to project management, take ownership of the design environment and project setup (subversion repository, maven project structure, collaboration environment, internal and external documentation sets). The service is Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) based and is deployed on an Ericsson clustered virtualized application server. Main challenges of this project are the handling of complex subscriber call flows and changes to the interfaces to external nodes using protocols like SOAP, SIGTRAN, various protocols to interact with charging nodes (AIR nodes, Voucher Server, MINSAT nodes), MSCML for control of the MRF announcement function, and SIP to integrate with the S-CSCF node and core network. My background in design allows me to work on a complex design project while my background in integration allows me to, for example, improve installation procedures and configuration documentation.

projects.title: Integration project on-site for a customer in South Africa
projects.description: Integration project on-site for a customer in South Africa. Responsible for installation, integration and acceptance test of a value added service solution in the service layer with geographical redundant deployments and a complex network setup with IP/SCTP and redundant networks. The service layer node consisted of multiple RedHat hosts in a clustered setup with an NDB MySQL database server, a Weblogic JEE Application Server and various services to provide high availability and management functionality. Integration was performed towards the core network through traditional telecom protocols (such as SIGTRAN/CS1+/CAPv2/MAP) but also SIP, as well as integration towards OSS and BSS systems. As on-site integrator I maintained close contact with the local company, the customer and the design unit.
